Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class THtmlPrinter

java.lang.Object
harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.THtmlPrinter
public class THtmlPrinter
extends java.lang.Object
This class has the responsibilities to help tombolalib library users to print on paper tombola cards. The design principles should be as simple as effective. It uses several template prepared in html+css format having inside some placeholders marked with specific character sequences. To print series of cards, placeholders are substituted by actual numbers, card labels, etc. and output file are generated in plain html+css format. Such file can thus be printed using any modern browser (i.e. Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome, Safari, Firefox, etc.). Standard format are provided to print one or more card per pages, as well as to make available different styles and graphic layouts.  User can also prepare and use their own templates, following instruction provided within the library user documentation.
Since:
1.8
Version:
1.1
Author:
Harry G Potter harry.g.potter@gmail.com
See Also:
TFileFormatter, TCard

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    THtmlPrinter​(java.lang.String templateFilePath)
    The constructor requires the file name (complete path9 where the template to use is located.  A not null nor empty string must be provided. Check to control file presence and validity is not performed at construction time, but just before the parsing and output process starts.

    Allow to define which number, string, placeholder or html encoding must be used to put a "not a number" on one of the 18 cell composing a card. Default value is the "Non breakable Space" html tag, that is &nbsp;

  • Constructor Details

    • THtmlPrinter

      public THtmlPrinter​(java.lang.String templateFilePath)
      The constructor requires the file name (complete path9 where the template to use is located.  A not null nor empty string must be provided. Check to control file presence and validity is not performed at construction time, but just before the parsing and output process starts.
      Parameters:
      templateFilePath - relative or absolute complete path specifying the valid template file to use.

  • Method Details

    • printHtml

      public int printHtml​(TSeriesList tsl, int first, int last, java.lang.String outFilename, java.nio.file.OpenOption options) throws java.io.IOException
      Use this method to generate the HTML file to be used to print cards. It took in input a TSeriesList object, the indexes of the first and last cards to be printed (belonging to the [0, series.size()*6] range) and the name of the output file to generate (template filename is specified within the constructor). Standard options for the output file (i.e. overwrite, append, etc.) can also be specified.
      Parameters:
      tsl - the whole list of series to be printed
      first - the index of the first card within the series list to be printed
      last - the index of the last card within the series list to be printed
      outFilename - the absolute or relative name of the html output file to be generated.
      options - specify file writing options (i.e. overwrite, append, etc.)
      Returns:
      the number of printed cards if everything goes ok, a negative value indicating the kind of error otherwise: -1 if the list of series object is null or empty -2 the output filename is null or empty -3 the html template set at construction time is not valid or has formal errors raising during parsing.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - is something goes wrong when writing the file.

    • setNoNumberTag

      public void setNoNumberTag​(java.lang.String tag)
      Allow to define which number, string, placeholder or html encoding must be used to put a "not a number" on one of the 18 cell composing a card. Default value is the "Non breakable Space" html tag, that is &nbsp;
      Parameters:
      tag - the String to use in place of a missing number on the tombola grid.

    • getNoNumberTag

      public java.lang.String getNoNumberTag()
      Return the string used to print a "no number" cell on the tombola card.
      Returns:
      the string used to print a "no number" cell on the tombola card

    • setDateFormatter

      public void setDateFormatter​(java.lang.String dateFormat)
      Set the format to use to print "date" fields within the html output file.
      Parameters:
      dateFormat - the string expressing, using standard Java format tags, the format to use

    • setTineStampFormatter

      public void setTineStampFormatter​(java.lang.String tsFormat)
      Set the format to use to print "timestamp" fields within the html output file.
      Parameters:
      tsFormat - the string expressing, using standard Java format tags, the format to use

    • enableJolly

      public void enableJolly​(boolean highlightJolly)
      Allow the highlights on printed paper of jolly numbers.
      Parameters:
      highlightJolly - true to apply jolly CSS styles to the number marked as jolly on each card, false to suppress the highlight of jolly numbers.

    • isJollyEnabled

      public boolean isJollyEnabled()
      Return true is jolly are marked with a specific CSS style, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true is jolly are marked with a specific CSS style, false otherwise.
